Class Hand

java.lang.Object
logic.gamesystem.Hand
public class Hand extends Object
Represents the player's current hand of cards during a turn.

A Hand stores a mutable list of Card objects. Cards are typically replaced at the beginning of each turn and consumed when played. This class provides simple list-like operations suitable for turn-based card usage.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hand

      public Hand()
      Constructs an empty hand.

  • Method Details

    • setCards

      public void setCards(List<Card> newCards)
      Replaces the entire hand with a new list of cards.

      The existing hand is cleared first. If newCards is null, the hand becomes empty.

      Parameters:
      newCards - the new cards to populate the hand with

    • get

      public Card get(int index)
      Returns the card at the given index, or null if the index is invalid.
      Parameters:
      index - position of the requested card
      Returns:
      the card at that index, or null if out of range

    • remove

      public void remove(int index)
      Removes the card at the specified index.

      If the index is invalid, the call is ignored.

      Parameters:
      index - index of the card to remove

    • discardAll

      public void discardAll()
      Discards all cards from the hand.

      After calling this, the hand becomes empty.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of cards currently in the hand.
      Returns:
      number of cards
